sentence.Network_en: Anyone with a discerning eye can easily see.
I think that sums up the feelings of most discerning and intelligent Indians.
sentence.Network_cn: 我想这概括了最富洞察力和悟性的印第安人的感受。

区分矩阵（Discernibility Matrix）是由波兰华沙大学的著名数学家skowron提出来的，是近年来在粗糙集约简上出现的一个有力工具。

entry.tran: 有识别力的;有眼力的;有洞察力的
entry.def: If you describe someone as discerning, you mean that they are able to judge which things of a particular kind are good and which are bad.

example.ex: ...tailor-made holidays to suit the more discerning traveller...
example.tran: 为懂行的旅游者量身打造的假期

example.ex: Her childhood passion for collecting has not dimmed, but now she is more discerning.
example.tran: 她孩提时培养起的对收藏的痴迷丝毫未减，现在只是变得更有眼力了。

means.word_mean: 1. having or revealing keen insight and good judgment;

sentences.sentence: "a kind and apprehensive friend"- Nathaniel Hawthorne

means.word_mean: 4. able to make or detect effects of great subtlety; sensitive;

auth_sentence.content: Great for those with small bladders or discerning bottoms.

auth_sentence.content: They're more discerning and they have disposable income.

auth_sentence.content: But black voters tend to be more discerning than that.
